text:
Electrical vehicles are our best shot at changing our ways of moving around. To do so, efficient and cheap batteries will be needed. The most prominent technologie right now is the Li-Ion one. It it based on the use of lithium ions, put in an organic and acid solution. It is already used in all of our techs, such as phones or computers, and of course, in electrical cars. But this technologie has multiple problems. First of all, its components are getting quite rare as lithium is not findable everywhere. Then, it is quite hard to recycle such batteries nowadays. We know how to do it, but it is still quite expensive and there are not enough facilities able to do it for the moment. Also, extracting lithium from the Earth is quite expensive and pollutes a lot, since it uses big machines that consume a lot of fuel. Finally, because of theses problems and a few others, these Li-Ions batteries are getting more and more expensive (although the increase in cost in downscaled by the mass effect of the growing batterie industry).
However, there are a few technologies that could replace Li-Ion, and solve these problems. One of the most promising one right now is the Na-Ion batterie technologie. It would work in the same way as the previous one I talked about, but use sodium, which is much cheaper and easier to extracts as it is present on Earth in bigger amounts than lithium. This technologie is still a work in progress, but is being researched by quite a lot of people around the world, and a lot of them are in Paris !
There are a few other technologies that could replace the ones se use for our cars. For example, we could still use fuel based vehicles, but that fuel could be e-fuel, made from bio-waste. Hydrogen cars are also a good alternative, but as of right now, the production of the reservoirs for hydrogen pollutes too much for this technology to be considered a viable solution.
In the end, what needs to be remembered is that we need to develop new technologies and ways of transportation if we do not want to destroy our planet. Therefore, lots of different solutions are being studied. The general thought in this field is that some technologies will suit better some means of transports than others. For example, e-fuel and hydrogen might be a better fit for trucks and buses, where electrical motors will work better for our everyday cars.
